description: The Obama administration approved guidelines on Friday for seismic searches for oil and gas deposits in the Atlantic Ocean, handing the petroleum industry a significant victory in a bitter dispute with environmental groups over the searches impact on marine life.

title: A Loss (Sabathia, for the Season) Before a Win for the Yankees
description: The news that C. C. Sabathia would have knee surgery and miss the rest of the season was hardly stunning: He experienced pain and swelling the day after pitching for Class AA Trenton on July 2 and was shut down, making surgery the most likely course of action.

title: Needing Skilled Workers, a Booming Germany Woos Immigrants
description: BERLIN  After just a few months in Germany, Cristina Torres knows she would like to stay here in Berlin, where her husband is studying global production engineering and their 21-month-old daughter can grow up in safety.

title: A Sumptuous Supper and Setting
description: Luxury at the Mayflower Grace hotel, in the Litchfield County town of Washington, is embodied in its parklike setting, by its two-story antique-laden entrance foyer, and by its spa services that go well beyond massages, facials and miscellaneous scrubs and wraps. Luxury is also evident in its restaurant, Muse by Jonathan Cartwright, where candles and sterling silver salt and pepper shakers adorn linen-draped tables, and veranda seating overlooks an exquisitely manicured garden.

title: Tom Tierney, Who Made Paper Dolls an Art Form, Dies at 85
description: Tom Tierney, who quite by accident found fame and fortune dressing  and undressing  notables from George Washington to Greta Garbo to Pope John Paul II, died on July 12 at his home in Smithville, Tex. Mr. Tierney, who almost single-handedly revived the lost art of paper-doll making, was 85.

title: Dust Still Settling in Aftermath of Move by LeBron James
description: Nobody expected N.B.A. free agency to be dull or predictable, and even the leaguewide holding pattern as the games top player evaluated his options this month was fraught with intrigue. LeBron James was in control of the process, his decision to return to the Cleveland Cavaliers instantly setting in motion dozens of interconnected moves.

title: Two Ex-Players Say Players Union Withheld Information
description: Two retired professional football players sued the N.F.L. Players Association for concealing from them information about the dangers of repeated head hits. The lawsuit filed on Thursday in United States District Court in Missouri echoes hundreds of similar cases against the N.F.L. and may represent a new front in the legal battle over concussions in sports.

title: Ethiopia: Bloggers and Journalists Are Charged as Terrorists
description: Three Ethiopian journalists and six bloggers were charged with planning terrorist attacks during a court hearing in Addis Ababa on Friday morning, nearly three months after they were arrested. The charges, under a sweeping antiterrorism law passed in 2009, were dismissed by the defendants lawyer, Ameha Mekonnen, as lacking specificity. If you read the text between the lines, it doesnt make any sense, he said. Its nonsense. Prime Minister Hailemariam Desalegn of Ethiopia said late Friday, however, that the case had nothing to do with the defendants profession. I dont think becoming a blogger makes somebody immune, if someone involves into this terrorist network that destabilizes my country, he said.

title: Embrace the Fuzz of New Jerseys Peaches
description: At Demarest Farms in Hillsdale, midsummer brings peach season, when Jason DeGise and James Spollen, the owners, are constantly reminded that the public can be out of touch with peaches in their natural state.

title: NBC Correspondent Ayman Mohyeldin Is Returned to Gaza
description: Only days after NBC removed him from its coverage of the fighting in Gaza, the correspondent Ayman Mohyeldin will be reinstated and sent back into the region, the network said Friday evening.

title: Central American Leaders to Meet Obama on Migrants
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama has summoned the presidents of Guatemala, El Salvador and Honduras to the White House next week in an effort to demonstrate high-level cooperation to stanch the flow of migrant children from Central America through Mexico and into the United States.

title: Friday Night Music: Lake Street Dive, What Im Doing Here
description: When I heard this I assumed it was an old standard  but no, Rachael Price wrote it, and the performance  well, just listen.

title: Questions on Funding for Lawyer in Terror Case
description: Just months before a Libyan terrorism defendant is scheduled for trial in Manhattan, a dispute has arisen over who is paying his legal fees and whether his poor health would interfere with resolving that issue.

title: Israel Ready to Expand Ground Forces
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said Friday that the Israeli military was ready for a significant expansion of ground forces in Gaza.

title: Part-Time Schedules, Full-Time Headaches
description: A worker at an apparel store at Woodbury Common, an outlet mall north of New York City, said that even though some part-time employees clamored for more hours, the store had hired more part-timers and cut many workers hours to 10 a week from 20.

title: ISIS Forces Last Iraqi Christians to Flee Mosul
description: BAGHDAD  By 1 p.m. on Friday almost every Christian in Mosul had heard the Sunni militants message  they had until noon Saturday to leave the city.

title: When Settlement Buys Time
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Kevin Turner and Sean Morey played a combined 17 years in the N.F.L. They were never teammates, but they became friends in 2010 when they worked with the Mackey-White Traumatic Brain Injury Committee for disabled retirees. They consulted with doctors studying the effects of concussions on football players. Morey raised money for Turners foundation after Turner received a diagnosis of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, or A.L.S., four years ago.

title: From a Local Artist, the Great Outdoors
description: In 2009, Beth E. Levinthal, the executive director of the Hofstra University Museum, received an intriguing call from a member of the family of Don Resnick, a Long Island landscape painter who had died the year before at age 80: Would the museum, the caller wondered, like to be given a few of the artists paintings?

title: A Classroom Leaves the Syllabus to the Students
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa.  The scene in a cavernous building atop a forested hill here resembles a brainy, free-form summer camp, or a loft where twentysomethings meet to pursue esoteric dreams. It does not look like the usual notion of college.

title: Astros Fail to Sign Top Pick; Holliday Paces Cards to Win
description: On June 5, the night of the baseball draft, Reid Ryan, the Houston Astros president of business operations, tweeted a photo of a Brady Aiken jersey in a team gift shop.

title: Pakistans Struggle Against Polio
description: The campaign in Pakistan to contain an uncontrolled outbreak of polio hit an alarming point this week when the nations tally of new cases exceeded last years total of 93, with months to go in the emergency effort to vaccinate children over fierce opposition from the Taliban.

title: New Art at Parrish: Theater
description: Since opening its sleek, barnlike headquarters on the East End two years ago, the Parrish Art Museum in Water Mill has expanded its cultural agenda to include circus arts, jazz and yoga. Now the museum can add live theater to the mix. This month it will present the world premiere of an adaptation of the 1985 Kurt Vonnegut novel Galpagos.

title: At Long Last, Justice for Ronnie White
description: In Congress, as in life, circumstances seldom collide to allow correction of a glaring injustice. Yet that is what happened in the Senate on Wednesday, when the chamber confirmed Ronnie White for a seat on the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Missouri.

title: General Motors Resists Expanding Victims Fund
description: The cars are different, but the circumstances surrounding their recall are strikingly similar.

title: Arizona: Mom of Boys Left in Car May Be Spared Charge
description: A prosecutor has agreed to drop felony child abuse charges againstShanesha Taylor, 35, a homeless mother who left her two sons in a hot car while she went to a job interview, if she completes parenting and substance abuse treatment programs and sets up trust funds for her children. The money is to come from the $115,000 donated to Ms. Taylor after her case drew national attention. Bill Montgomery, the Maricopa County attorney, said the deal would hold Ms. Taylor accountable while also recognizing the best interests of her family. She is seeking to regain custody of her children, who were placed in foster care after her arrest.

title: G.M. Rebuked in the Senate
description: A consistent theme in the emerging revelations about General Motors deadly ignition switch has been the central role the companys legal department played in concealing the problem from the public, government safety regulators and purchasers for more than a decade.

title: Israels War in Gaza
description: After 10 days of aerial bombardment, Israel sent tanks and ground troops into Gaza to keep Hamas from pummeling Israeli cities with rockets and carrying out terrorist attacks via underground tunnels. The tragedy is that innocent civilians on both sides of the border are paying the price, once again, and that military action will not guarantee long-term stability or peace.

title: Padres Offense May Go Down as Worst Ever
description: Because of baseballs long history, there is usually comfort in knowing that as bad as it gets for your team, there is almost always some other club that was worse. But the 2014 San Diego Padres might not have that consolation. At this point, their awful offense is about as bad as any in history, and there are still more than 60 games to be played.

title: Downing of Jet Exposes Defects of Flight Precautions Over Ukraine
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  As this Southeast Asian nation mourns the loss of scores of passengers aboard another lost Malaysia Airlines Boeing 777-200, the precautions instituted by the aviation authorities and flight planners to protect commercial aviation along the Russian-Ukrainian border have been shown to be catastrophically insufficient.

title: Stop. Hey, Whats That Sound?
description: If, as the sound artist Stephan Moore likes to say, the laptop has become the 21st-century folk instrument, then the Caramoor Center for Music and the Arts in Katonah has propelled itself to the forefront of that development, commissioning and bringing to its 90-acre campus an exhibition of sound art featuring 10 works by 11 laptop-wielding artists.

title: The $300,000 Drug
description: Kalydeco is truly a wonder drug.

title: For High School Senior, Its Clarinet First, Then Homework
description: Phillip H. Solomon, a senior at Hendrick Hudson High School in Montrose, did not expect to win a position as a clarinetist in the National Youth Orchestra of the United States of America. Every young musician I know had applied, Mr. Solomon, 16, said.

title: UConn to Pay $1.3 Million to End Suit on Rape Cases
description: The University of Connecticut will pay $1.28 million to settle a lawsuit filed by five students who charged that the university had treated their claims of sexual assault and harassment with indifference, the two sides announced on Friday in a joint statement.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for July 18, 2014
The Netherlands, a Nation in Mourning but Mindful of Ties to Russia
description: AMSTERDAM  Flags flew at half-staff Friday in this small but extremely international country, one that is accustomed to standing on the forefront of global cultural debates over such things as gay rights, euthanasia and marijuana policies. But on Thursday, after the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17, the Netherlands found itself thrust squarely into an unaccustomed role at the center of the realpolitik of the conflict in Ukraine.

title: Next Gold Rush: Legal Marijuana Feeds Entrepreneurs Dreams
description: DENVER  Like the glint of gold or rumors of oil in ages past, the advent of legal, recreational marijuana is beginning to reshape economies in Colorado and Washington State.

title: Presidents Find Occasions, Far More than Occasionally, for Proclamations
description: WASHINGTON  The White House on May 30 issued a proclamation formally declaring June as Great Outdoors Month. President Obama reaffirmed his commitment to preserving the nations lands and waters, and urged all Americans to explore the great outdoors.

title: Relaxed Thief Is Videotaped as He Browses
description: There is a white board marked Food for Thought inside the office door at Red Rabbit, a business that sells healthy meals for schoolchildren, and every morning an employee jots an inspirational or funny quotation with a marker. The board served a less whimsical purpose on July 4.

title: With Grief on Top of Grief, Malaysians Are Tested on Flight 370s Lessons
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  Still raw from the loss of one airliner four months ago, Malaysians on Friday confronted the improbable loss of another passenger jet, this time the victim of a conflict far from home.

title: A Young Mother, Damaged by the War
description: The problem of sexual abuse in the American military system is the subject of Soldiers Heart, a new drama by Tammy Ryan. This sometimes compelling play is currently presented in Union by Premiere Stages, which produced her Lost Boy Found in Whole Foods in 2010.

title: A Mother Asks Obama: Please Remember My Amir
description: The mother of Amir Hekmati, an American of Iranian descent imprisoned in Tehran for nearly three years, has written to President Obama, asking him to please remember my Amir in the negotiations with Iran over its disputed nuclear program.

title: For the G.O.P., Fine Line Seen on Migration
description: WASHINGTON  In 1996, when a surge in illegal immigration collided with the overheated politics of a presidential election, Republicans demanded a strict crackdown.

title: Rebels in Ukraine Crowed of Past Attacks, but Deny This One
description: GRABOVO, Ukraine  A blast from a shoulder-fired rocket takes down a Ukrainian military transport plane on its landing approach, killing 49 people. Twenty-three Ukrainian soldiers are slaughtered by Russian-made Grad rockets. An AN-26 military plane is shot down at 21,000 feet, an altitude reachable only by a sophisticated surface-to-air missile with radar guidance.

title: A Week of Agony, From Eastern Ukraine to the Gaza Strip
description: There are times when the endless crises and conflicts of our times reach such paroxysms of senseless tragedy that the world cries out for a halt.

title: Across a Grocery Chain, a Labor Protest in Support of a Manager
description: TEWKSBURY, Mass.  It was a highly unusual sight: business executives in suits alongside warehouse workers wearing tank tops, all rallying against changes in the management of their employer, a successful New England supermarket chain. But allied they were this week in an unusual labor action, fallout from the latest chapter in a decades-old family feud that pits two Arthurs against each other.

title: Where the Lowing Herd Wind Slowly
description: Administrivial Alert! In the Sunday, July 20 main puzzle, there will be a note that reads: The answer to each starred clue must have two consecutive letters removed before it is written into the grid. These letters will move to a pair of circles elsewhere in the puzzle. (In all cases, new words will be formed.) The nine letter pairs, when properly arranged, will spell an appropriate answer at 72-Across.

title: Fleeing Amid Airstrikes, Gazans Find Few Places to Be Safe
description: BEIT LAHIYA, Gaza Strip  They fled by night, using their cellphones as flashlights on pitch-black roads as Israeli shells whistled around them. They carried a white flag and dragged crying children at a trot, a family of 25 headed for a relatives house farther into the Gaza Strip.

title: Otto Piene, German Artist of New Modes, Dies at 85
description: Otto Piene, a German painter and sculptor known for his experiments in kinetic art and for working at the junction of art, nature and technology, died on Thursday in Berlin, where he was attending the opening of a retrospective of his work. He was 86 and had homes in Dsseldorf and Groton, Mass.

title: A Dialogue Between Hemispheres
description: An exhibition at the Bruce Museum in Greenwich has fostered an unusual cross-cultural dialogue between artists in two capitals of the contemporary art world.

title: Vikings Say Report Contradicts Many of Kluwes Claims
description: The Minnesota Vikings said on Friday that a six-month investigation had refuted many of the charges made by the teams former punter, Chris Kluwe, who claimed that he was released in 2013 in retaliation for his support of same-sex marriage.

title: Corrections: July 19, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 9:30 P.M. (History) THE UNKNOWN KNOWN (2013) The director Errol Morris and the former defense secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld square off in a battle of wits and words on topics including truth, power, torture and the Iraq war as Mr. Rumsfeld, above, reads aloud from a dozen or so of the most memorable memos  or snowflakes, as they were known at the Pentagon  he composed during his six-year tenure in the administration of George W. Bush. Yes, it is a probing and unsettling inquiry into the recent political and military history of the United States, but it is also a bracing and invigorating philosophical skirmish, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. The tension between those two registers  between hard facts about state violence and devilish abstractions about causes and consequences  is what gives the film some of its energy and suspense. The film, he added, is a cat-and-mouse game in which each player thinks hes the cat, making it both thrilling and disconcerting to watch. It is also a nature documentary about behavior at the very top of the imperial food chain and a detective story about the search for a mystery that is hidden in plain sight.

title: Bilbo Baggins Slept Here
description: Its dinner and a movie  set. The Hobbiton Movie Set in New Zealand, as seen in the screen adaptations of J. R. R. TolkiensLord of the Ringstrilogy andThe Hobbit,is offering night tours of Bilbo Bagginss homeland.

title: Among the Victims: One U.S. Citizen and a Dutch Student at Indiana
description: To those who knew her at Indiana University, Karlijn Keijzer seemed to excel at everything she did, from her work as a doctoral student in chemistry to her leadership on the universitys rowing team.

title: Mets Stay Hot as dArnaud Delivers Early and Late
description: SAN DIEGO  Travis dArnaud, the Mets prized young catcher, might have added a useful tool during his trip to the minor leagues last month: patience.

title: Income Inequality Is Not Rising Globally. It's Falling.
description: Income inequality has surged as a political and economic issue, but the numbers dont show that inequality is rising from a global perspective. Yes, the problem has become more acute within most individual nations, yet income inequality for the world as a whole  has been falling for most of the last 20 years. Its a fact that hasnt been noted often enough.

title: Despite Israeli Push in Gaza, Hamas Fighters Slip Through Tunnels
description: GAZA CITY  Eight Palestinian militants emerged from a tunnel some 300 yards inside Israel on Saturday morning, armed with automatic weapons and wearing Israeli military uniforms, the Israeli military said. The gunmen fired a rocket-propelled grenade at two Israeli military jeeps on patrol, starting a battle that killed two Israeli officers and one of the militants, according to the military. The rest then retreated underground, back to Gaza.

title: Analytics: The G.O.P. Idea Machine
description: The following Analytics appears on the Reply All page in the July 20 issue of the magazine.

title: Ukraine Says It Can Prove Russia Supplied Arms System That Felled Jet
description: KIEV, Ukraine  The Ukrainian government said on Saturday that it had proof that Russia had provided the surface-to-air missile system that shot down a Malaysia Airlines passenger jet over eastern Ukraine on Thursday, killing all 298 people aboard.

title: U.S. Drone Kills 15 Militants in Pakistan
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  Fifteen militants were killed early Saturday morning when an American drone struck a compound in the Pakistani tribal region of North Waziristan, according to local residents and a security official. It was the fourth known drone strike in the region since Pakistan launched a military operation there last month.

title: Scientists Begin to Demystify Hole Found in Siberian Permafrost
description: After a flood of speculation  meteorite collision, methane explosion related to gas drilling, UFO  following the discovery of a gaping crater in the permafrost near big gas fields on the Yamal peninsula in Siberia, scientists are starting to offer more informed views.

title: The Chatter for Sunday, July 20
description: The first step to building the right organization for our ambitions is to realign our work force.

title: Kat Cole of Cinnabon, on Questioning Success More Than Failure
description: This interview with Kat Cole, president of Cinnabon, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: The Job That Keeps Playing in My Head
description: This is what I remember about my year selling real estate: My boss couldnt stop singing. Every morning after he arrived at the office in Coralville, Iowa, he would collect his mail, visit the coffee maker, go to the mens room  all while spouting a medley of 1980s classic rock.

title: Many Are Knocking, but the Door Stays Closed
description: Email haggler@nytimes.com. Keep it brief and family-friendly, include your hometown and go easy on the caps-lock key. Letters may be edited for clarity and length.

title: Who Routinely Trounces the Stock Market? Try 2 Out of 2,862 Funds
description: When the stock market rose 30 percent in 2013, plenty of fund managers had a triumphant year.

title: Avoiding Roommate Shock, Online
description: Before Daniel Stompor arrived on campus last fall for his first year at Northwestern University, he went on Facebook, looking for a roommate.

title: Sometimes, Early Birds Are Too Early
description: Since the advent of the deadline, procrastinators have suffered societys barbs for putting off until later what needs doing now. But it turns out that many people appear to be finishing things sooner than they need to get them done. They are precrastinators, researchers say.

title: Your Rights, Buried in Paperwork
description: When shareholders receive takeover bids for their companies, they may feel like celebrating. But what if the buyout price doesnt fully reflect a fair value for the company?

title: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 Passenger Manifest
description: Here is a list of the passengers and crew members aboard Malaysia Airlines Flight 17. The Times is also compiling profiles of the victims. If you knew someone on the flight, you are invited to share your recollections.

title: Victims of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17
description: Among the 298 people aboard Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 were a renowned AIDS researcher, a Dutch senator and an Australian novelist.

title: Renovating a Kitchen as a Renter
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly online column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Lights, Camera, Action . . . Vacation!
description: Romes tourists are venerated and degraded inLa Grande Bellezza(The Great Beauty), a film by the Italian director Paolo Sorrentino that won this years Oscar for best foreign film. Whatever its views of visitors, the movie acts as an irresistible invitation to the Eternal Citys more subtly beguiling attractions, as its suave protagonist and the audience are coolly guided through hidden courtyards, historic palazzos and less-frequented works of architecture.

title: Struggling to Keep Afghan Girl Safe After a Mullah Is Accused of Rape
description: KUNDUZ, Afghanistan  It was bad enough that the alleged rape took place in the sanctity of a mosque, and that the accused man was a mullah who invoked the familiar defense that it had been consensual sex.

title: To Prevent Surprise Bills, New Health Law Rules Could Widen Insurer Networks
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration and state insurance regulators are developing stricter standards to address the concerns of consumers who say that many health plans under the Affordable Care Act have unduly limited their choices of doctors and hospitals, leaving them with unexpected medical bills.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Variety: Split Decisions
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  You dont really need me for this. Split Decisions are the easiest variety puzzles to learn because all you have to do is to start dropping letters into the squares and try to make them make pairs of words until you can drop your writing tool and say, There. I did it.

title: Investor Eases Money Pressure on American Apparel
description: American Apparel took another step away from a financial precipice this week when an investment firm bought a $10 million loan that had threatened to set off a string of defaults.

title: A Family Feud, Uncorked in Spain
description: When Pablo lvarez began sending invitations to a recent 150th anniversary party for Vega Sicilia, the historic winery he runs in the Ribera del Duero region of Spain, he offered one to his estranged father, David lvarez, who bought the winery in 1982. The party was sure to be a blowout, with 700 guests  including Soraya Senz de Santamara, the deputy prime minister of Spain, along with fans of the winery like Kurt Russell, Goldie Hawn and Kate Hudson  and with food provided by El Celler de Can Roca, a restaurant in Catalonia that is considered one of the worlds best.

title: Brothers Provide Italy With Relief on the Golf Course, at Least
description: HOYLAKE, England  Edoardo Molinari stood on a podium in the scoring area answering questions about his second round while, on a television situated a few feet to his left, a live feed of the players still on the course showed his brother, Francesco, finishing his round.

title: Staying the Course on Iran by Threatening Pain and Offering Relief
description: Behind President Obamas decision on Friday to extend the Iran nuclear negotiations for four more months is a calculation that the administration has the mix of pressure and incentives just about right: That by keeping the most damaging sanctions, but giving Tehran a taste of what access to its overseas cash reserves might mean, a deal is possible.

title: Russia Expands List of Barred Americans
description: MOSCOW  Russias Foreign Ministry announced Saturday that it was expanding its list of Americans barred from the country, including a congressman and several senior military officers.

title: No Credit? No Problem
description: Banks and private equity firms searching for high-yield investments have fueled a boom in subprime auto loans to buyers who cant afford them, including those who recently filed for bankruptcy.

title: Unlike the Weather, McIlroy Shows No Mercy
description: HOYLAKE, England  Despite ominous predictions and extreme measures, thunder and lightning never materialized to threaten the players during the third round at the British Open.

title: In a Subprime Bubble for Used Cars, Borrowers Pay Sky-High Rates
description: Rodney Durham stopped working in 1991, declared bankruptcy and lives on Social Security. Nonetheless, Wells Fargo lent him $15,197 to buy a used Mitsubishi sedan.

title: Jeter, Like Duncan, Makes the Routine Extraordinary
description: Like a runner leading off first base with a notion of stealing second, Derek Jeter leaned his right shoulder in the direction of the players private area of the Yankees clubhouse. In front of his conveniently situated dressing stall, eager to escape, he said, I only got a minute.

title: The Future of Robot Caregivers
description: EACH time I make a house call, I stay much longer than I should. I cant leave because my patient is holding my hand, or because shes telling me, not for the first time, about when Aunt Mabel cut off all her hair and they called her a boy at school, or how her daddy lost his job and the lights went out and her mother lit pine cones and danced and made everyone laugh. Sometimes I cant leave because she just has to show me one thing, but getting to that thing requires that she rise unsteadily from her chair, negotiate her walker through the narrow hallway, and find whatever it is in the dim light of her bedroom.

title: With Jet Strike, War in Ukraine Is Felt Globally
description: WASHINGTON  From the start, the telephone call did not go well. Dispensing with pleasantries, President Vladimir V. Putin launched into an edgy and long-winded complaint about the new American sanctions imposed on Russia the day before.

title: In Mexico, a Stalled Journey
description: While thousands of child migrants from Central America have crossed the Rio Grande to U.S. soil, thousands more dont make it that far. Many end up detained or broke in towns like Reynosa, Mexico.

title: Rush to Deport Young Migrants Could Trample Asylum Claims
description: HARLINGEN, Tex.  The first time her aunt in Mexico took her out at night, the young teenager was told they were headed to a party.

title: 5 Bombs Explode in Baghdad as Dispute Continues With Jordan
description: BAGHDAD  Five bombs exploded in the Iraqi capital on Saturday, killing 30 people, as tensions continued between Baghdad and Jordan, signaling the inexorable spillover of Iraqs troubles to the region.

title: Superpowers of the Web
description: Readers respond to a July 16 letter from Marc Rotenberg, an Internet privacy expert, calling on policy makers to examine the business practices of dominant Internet companies like Facebook and Google.

title: Sticking to His Travel Plans, at Risk of Looking Bad
description: WASHINGTON  As smoke billowed from the downed Malaysian jetliner in the fields of eastern Ukraine on Thursday, President Obama pressed ahead with his schedule: a cheeseburger with fries at the Charcoal Pit in Delaware, a speech about infrastructure and two splashy fund-raisers in New York City.

title: Midsummer Event, Midseason Form for SEC Fans
description: HOOVER, Ala.  Harrison Flick, 21, stood in a hotel lobby in this strip-mall suburb, wearing a Mississippi State football jersey. He was stoic about being the only Bulldogs fan in a sparse crowd Tuesday, the second morning of the Southeastern Conferences media days.

title: The Media Merger Arms Race
description: The news that 21st Century Fox recently offered to buy Time Warner for $80 billion should make clear  if there had been any doubt  that consolidation in the media and communications industries begets more consolidation.

title: Payday Lenders Set the Debt Trap
description: The federal Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has already taken important steps to protect consumers in mortgage transactions and has established oversight of student loans, credit reporting agencies and debt collectors. Now the bureau is formulating rules to protect borrowers from unscrupulous payday lenders. The payday industry bills itself as a source of convenient, short-term loans, but the business model depends on trapping people into borrowing again and again, paying onerous fees as they go.

title: Bottlenecks in Training Doctors
description: The new head of the Department of Veterans Affairs, Sloan Gibson, told a Senate committee last week that he needed $17.6 billion over the next three years to hire some 1,500 doctors, 8,500 nurses and other clinicians to reduce the unconscionably long waiting times that many veterans now endure before they are able to see a doctor.

title: Shekhar Garde
description: Shekhar Garde is an Indian-born chemical engineer at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. He studies the role of water in the creation of life and is a pioneer in animating molecular dynamics, producing a 3-D Imax film called Molecules to the Max.

title: Whos Right and Wrong in the Middle East?
description: WITH Israeli troops again invading Gaza and the death toll rising, some of the rhetoric from partisans on each side is oddly parallel. Maybe its time to correct a few common misconceptions among the salvos flying back and forth.

title: Our Love Affair With the Mug Shot
description: A YOUNG man faces the camera, shaved head, white tee. The rigid lines of the jaw and cheekbones are softened by the gentle curve of full lips. The hard tattoos slashing up the neck are sweetened by the fading teardrop inked under one eye. And those eyes: pale blue and looking directly at you.

title: Real Adventurers Read Maps
description: CALL me a fossil, but when I take a road trip I like to get around by using printed maps. Ive been licensed to drive for 20 years, and every car Ive owned has contained a Rand McNally Road Atlas, with the maps of the Northeastern states dog-eared and loosened from their staples. Navigating by map carries over to foreign roads, too. In May my wife and I went to France, where we drove around Provence and dipped a wheel into Italy.

title: The Parent Trap
description: WHEN I was about 9 years old, I graduated to a Little League whose diamonds were a few miles from our house, in a neighborhood that got rougher after dark. After one practice finished early, I ended up as the last kid left with the coach, waiting in the gloaming while he grumbled, looked at his watch and finally left me  to wait or walk home, Im not sure which.

title: Offering Clarity, but Blurring Lines, Too
description: WHEN Nate Silver left The Times last year for ESPN, it was not a happy moment for top editors. The statistical guru and political prognosticator had been extremely popular with readers and had brought a new audience to the paper and its website.

title: A Popular President
description: WASHINGTON  THE thing about him is, he just keeps going.

title: And Now for a Bit of Good News . . .
description: From Ukraine to the Middle East, some bad actors  Hamas, Vladimir Putin and Israeli settlers to name but a few  are trying to bury the future with the past and divide people. Instead of focusing on them even more, I prefer to write about a company that is burying the past with the future, and actually bringing strangers together.

title: The End of Genius
description: WHERE does creativity come from? For centuries, weve had a clear answer: the lone genius. The idea of the solitary creator is such a common feature of our cultural landscape (as with Newton and the falling apple) that we easily forget its an idea in the first place.

title: The Sage Grouse Versus Industry
description: A conservation effort across the West to protect the sage grouse, a bird with an unusual mating call, has put different environmental interests at odds.

title: What Writers Can Learn From Goodnight Moon
description: I gave birth to twins a little more than a year ago, and at the baby showers we received many books: colorful board books, big illustrated books, collections of Sandra Boynton and nursery rhymes and Dr. Seuss, but none multiple times except this one: a board book Goodnight Moon, a flimsy Goodnight Moon, a large lap book Goodnight Moon, and an anthology by the books author, Margaret Wise Brown. Of course, I thought. Its that one that says good night a lot. I figured Id read it before, just a story of going around the room saying good night to stuff, and I thought it was popular as a gift because its so appropriate for bedtime and everybody wants babies to sleep.

title: Frack Quietly, Please: Sage Grouse Is Nesting
description: CASPER, Wyo.  In a new oil field among the rolling hills near here, Chesapeake Energy limits truck traffic to avoid disturbing the breeding and nesting of a finicky bird called the greater sage grouse. To the west, on a gas field near Yellowstone National Park, Shell Oil is sowing its own special seed mix to grow plants that nourish the birds and hide their chicks from predators.

title: A Golf Hazard on the Way to a Tournament
description: HOYLAKE, England  On the first leg of Gary Woodlands British Open odyssey, he glanced out the airplane porthole in time to see a baggage handler at Kansas City International Airport haul his golf bag out of a cart, drop it on the tarmac and fling another suitcase on top of it. The sight of the tools of his trade being treated with such little care made Woodland so agitated that his fiance told him to turn away from the window.

title: Usher Signals
description: Many ushers communicate during church services using a sequence of hand signals called the National Silent Uniform System. Here are some of the central elements of these signals.

title: Influx of South Americans Drives Miamis Reinvention
description: MIAMI  As the World Cup played out over the past month, yellow-clad Colombians packed the Kukaramakara nightclub downtown, Aguila beers in hand, shouting, Colombia, Colombia! Outside, Brazilians in car caravans blasted samba music. Argentines, some in blue-and-white striped jerseys, jammed into nearby steakhouses and empanada joints. Around town, children filed into Sunday Mass, their jerseys ablaze with their futbol heroes from across Latin America.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, July 20
description: With two foreign crises  the Malaysia Airlines plane downed in Ukraine and the Israeli ground invasion in the Gaza Strip  erupting, Secretary of State John Kerry will appear on five Sunday talk shows, on ABC, CBS, CNN, NBC, and Fox News.

title: On Southern Border, Mexico Faces Crisis of Its Own
description: TENOSIQUE, Mexico  For years, Mexicos most closely watched border was its northern one, which generations of Mexican migrants have crossed seeking employment and refuge in the United States.

title: In Remote Corners of India, Immunity for Soldiers Who Kill and Rape Civilians
description: MAYAI LEIKAI, India  A dozen soldiers burst through the front and back doors of a small home here in the middle of a July night, dragged Thangjam Manorama into a room and began to torture her. Her older brother tried to stop them and was badly beaten. Her mother rose to defend her and was knocked unconscious.

title: Pathogen Mishaps Rise as Regulators Stay Clear
description: The recently documented mistakes at federal laboratories involving anthrax, flu and smallpox have incited public outrage at the governments handling of dangerous pathogens. But the episodes were just a tiny fraction of the hundreds that have occurred in recent years across a sprawling web of academic, commercial and government labs that operate without clear national standards or oversight, federal reports show.

title: Second Days Effort Pays for a Climber From Poland
description: RISOUL, France  For Rafal Majka, persistence paid off on Saturday. The day before, Majka, a Polish climbing specialist, found himself off the front of the final Alpine climb of a Tour de France stage with Leopold Konig, a Czech rider. But the two fell victim to a show of force from the Tour leader, Vincenzo Nibali, who passed them for the win.

title: Making the N.F.L.s Biggest Screens
description: Shahid Khan is the owner of the Jacksonville Jaguars, a team that hasnt made the playoffs since the 2007 season. He is spending $20 million of his own money on the biggest end-zone video displays.

title: Vows | An Imperfect Beginning
description: Vince Taylor and Rebekah Gordon moved slowly and deliberately from friendship to romance. Because in the balance were Mr. Taylors children and the breakup of his existing marriage.

title: New Dimension in Scoreboard Watching
description: BROOKINGS, S.D.  The seemingly endless prairie that blankets this part of the United States would seem to be an unlikely place for one of the largest makers of sports video displays, Daktronics. After all, the nearest big-league ballpark is a four-hour drive from this town, which has barely enough residents to fill any of the arenas and stadiums where the high-tech screens are fixtures.

title: Arsenal Refilled, a New Yankee Throws a Gem
description: During his time with the Arizona Diamondbacks, Brandon McCarthy was told by the team to stop throwing his cut fastball, a pitch that had been essential to his success over the years.

title: Readers Comment on my Middle East Column
description: My Sunday column is about the Middle East crisis and the Israeli incursion into Gazabut, more fundamentally, about the way hardliners on each side have dominated the narrative and created conditions in which hardliners on the other side are empowered. And the reasonable folks, such as Mahmoud Abbas on the Palestinian side and the Labor Party and liberal civil society on the Israeli side, become somewhat marginalized.

title: Jury Awards $23.6 Billion in Florida Smoking Case
description: MIAMI  A jury in northwestern Florida awarded a staggering $23 billion judgment late Friday against the countrys second-largest tobacco company for causing the death of a chain smoker who died of lung cancer at the age of 36.

title: Palestinians Find Show of Support Lacking From Arab Leaders Amid Offensive
description: CAIRO  Three years ago there was a hope that a growing movement for democracy might make Arab countries more supportive of the Palestinians, as governments grew more responsive to the people and their demands.

title: Before Leaving Tour de France, a Rider Displays a Champions Endurance
description: Andrew Talansky, one of the United States top road cyclists, never expected to spend the second half of the Tour de France on a lounge chair at his pool in Girona, Spain, with an ice pack chilling his ailing back and gauze covering several spots on his body now missing layers of skin.

title: Attack Kills at Least 21 Egyptian Soldiers at Checkpoint in Western Desert
description: CAIRO  At least 21 Egyptian soldiers were killed on Saturday when heavily armed gunmen attacked a border guard post near a remote desert oasis, according to an army spokesman.

title: Always Inflation Somewhere
description: Whenever you point out that the hyperinflation the usual suspects have been predicting for the past 6 years hasnt materialized, you get a rash of comments declaring that yes it has, the government is just lying about the statistics. One answer  aside from come on, how do you think that works?  is that independent measures, like the Billion Price Index, arent very different from the official index. Still, people will point to the price of something that has gone up as evidence that we have lots of inflation.

title: A Three-Sibling Rivalry Extends to the Pro Ranks
description: As the father of three competitive, athletic sons, Jeff Seager knows well the joys  and the perils  of raising a family around sports. Pickup games could be a problem.

title: Behind the Tour de France, the Teams Pursue a Quest for Next Years Sponsorships
description: GRENOBLE, France  When Gerry Ryan, an Australian businessman, was asked why he owns a professional cycling team, he replied with a wry laugh.

title: Shake-Up on Opium Island
description: Now is the sowing season for opium poppies in the Australian state of Tasmania. Tractors chug up and down paddocks, pulling elaborate machinery that drills pairs of adjacent, miniature holes in the dirt, and then drops a dozen tiny kernels of fertilizer in one of the holes and a tiny poppy seed in the other.

title: Moving Parts
description: Administrivial Alert  In todays puzzle, there will be a note in most versions that reads: The answer to each starred clue must have two consecutive letters removed before it is written into the grid. These letters will move to a pair of circles elsewhere in the puzzle. (In all cases, new words will be formed.) The nine letter pairs, when properly arranged, will spell an appropriate answer at 72-Across.

title: Stranded at the Border
description: Mexico is trying to slow down the flow of migrants coming though its southern border by detaining them, and sometimes deporting them back to its Central American neighbors.

title: An Honors Assembly for a Coachs Pupils
description: HOYLAKE, England  With his thinning hair and his thickening waistline, Butch Harmon has a way of blending into the crowd when he follows his players competitive rounds on foot. On Saturday at the British Open, though, there was no missing him.

title: Young South Korean Rolls, Then Teeters on 2nd Nine
description: HOYLAKE, England  As Byeong-Hun An found out Saturday during the third round of the British Open, learning how to contend in the majors is like learning how to ride a bike.

title: Prized Prospect Turns Into a Must-Watch Rookie, Quickly, for the Reds
description: Against the Pittsburgh Pirates recently in Cincinnati, the rookie center fielder Billy Hamilton, leading off for the Reds, dropped a bunt down the first-base line. The bunt appeared to be poorly executed, hit too sharply to first. The fielder, Gaby Sanchez, fielded it cleanly and intercepted Hamiltons path to the bag. But Hamilton was gone.

title: Yehuda Nir, a Psychiatrist and Holocaust Survivor, Dies at 84
description: Dr. Yehuda Nir, a psychiatrist whose childhood was shaped by having to masquerade as a Roman Catholic in German-occupied Poland to escape Nazi persecution, an ordeal that he turned into a well-received memoir and that guided him in treating victims of trauma, died on Saturday at his home in Manhattan. He was 84.

title: Complaints About Chokeholds Are Focus of Study
description: The city agency that investigates allegations of police misconduct is studying the more than 1,000 complaints it has received in recent years about police officers using chokeholds, the agency said on Saturday, two days after a man died following a police encounter in which the hold appeared to be used.

title: As They Assess Needs, Mets Show Shortcomings
description: SAN DIEGO  When Travis dArnaud slapped a two-out, full-count, letter-high fastball from Joaquin Benoit into right field in the ninth inning Friday night, he did more than drive in Curtis Granderson for the winning run in the Mets 5-4 victory over the San Diego Padres.

title: Champions Luck Runs Out at His Favorite Tournament
description: Fabiano Caruana of Italy took the early lead at the Sparkassen Chess Meeting in Dortmund, Germany, by winning three of his first four games, while Vladimir Kramnik of Russia, who has won the title 10 times, had a rocky start.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for July 19, 2014
Teenagers Zverev and Konjuh Find Success in a Veteran-Dominated Sport
description: Two teenagers each reached the semifinals of tournaments this week, crashing parties that have been restricted to much older crowds in recent years.

title: In Hospitals Across Gaza, Scenes of Chaos and Grief
description: JABALIYA CAMP, Gaza Strip  The ambulance at Kamal Adwan, the main hospital in the northern Gaza Strip, already had turned on its sirens to move a critically injured man to a better-equipped hospital. Several women blocked its way, one of them clinging to the vehicle and trying to open the side door. Only when she fainted from emotion could the ambulance leave.

title: Some Backlash in Texas to the Housing of Children Crossing the Border
description: City Councilwoman Heidi Thiess of League City swung into action shortly after she saw media reports of Central American children sleeping in cramped detention centers along the Texas-Mexico border.

title: Texas Sheriffs Mull Selling E-Cigarettes to Inmates
description: As a way to allow some inmates to get their nicotine fix and sheriffs to shore up tight budgets, county jails across the country have begun selling electronic cigarettes. Though the trend has largely bypassed Texas, jail officials say that could change as sheriffs begin to warm up to the smokeless technology.

title: A Taste for Craft Beers in Rural Texas
description: ALPINE  More than 400 people gathered this month just outside Alpine in a windswept part of Far West Texas to sample craft beer and celebrate the expansion of the Big Bend Brewing Company.

title: State Weighs Restructuring Health Plans for Women
description: Texas lawmakers are looking for ways to fill the gaps in access to health care for the states poorest women, three years after making sharp cuts to the states family planning budget and rejecting a federally financed womens health program in favor of their own.

title: Lisa Baker, Gus Steadman
description: Lisa Marie Baker and William Angus Steadman II were married Saturday at North Beach Park in Ferrysburg, Mich. Bryan Robert Paul, a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Kristen Bucaria, Daniel Fletcher
description: Kristen Marie Bucaria and Daniel Timothy Fletcher were married Monday in New York. The Rev. Katherine Jeddah Vailakis, an interfaith minister who was ordained by the New Seminary, officiated at Cop Cot, a wooden shelter in Central Park.

title: Marci Doucet, David McGovern
description: Marci Elizabeth Doucet and David Kavanagh McGovern were married Saturday at Our Lady of Mount Carmel Church on St. John in the United States Virgin Islands. The Rev. Anthony B. Abraham, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Kathryn Hogan, Joshua Berger
description: Kathryn Patricia Hogan and Joshua Craig Berger were married Saturday at St. Pauls University Chapel in Madison, Wis. The Rev. Carl Morello, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated, with Rabbi James L. Sagarin taking part.

title: Christina Crowe, Michael Nilson
description: Christina Hope Crowe and Michael Louis Nilson were married Saturday at St. Catharines Church, in Blauvelt, N.Y. Bishop Robert E. Guglielmone of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Charleston, S.C., performed the ceremony.

title: Jaclyn Simon, Brian Whittaker
description: Jaclyn Unis Simon and Brian James Whittaker were married Saturday in Villanova, Pa. The Rev. Joseph Mostardi, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Thomas of Villanova Church on the campus of Villanova University.

title: Aparna Saraf and Omar Isani
description: Aparna Arvind Saraf, a daughter of Dr. Asha A. Saraf and Dr. Arvind N. Saraf of Moorestown, N.J., was married Saturday evening to Omar Ali Isani, the son of Dr. Shaheen Isani and Dr. Alamgir Isani of Englewood Cliffs, N.J. Katherine Kurs, a minister at West-Park Presbyterian Church in New York, officiated at the Plaza in New York.

title: Caroline Boeke and Alejandro Sanchez
description: Caroline Elizabeth Boeke and Alejandro Sanchez were married on Saturday at St. Katharine Drexel Summer Chapel in Harpswell, Me. The Rev. Frank Murray, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Jodi Leib, Jonathan Coden
description: Jodi Rachelle Leib and Jonathan Daniel Coden were married Saturday at Temple Israel in West Bloomfield, Mich. Rabbi Harold S. Loss performed the ceremony with Rabbi Paul M. Yedwab taking part.

title: Theyd Bet That Opposites Attract
description: Olivia Tess Cranin and Scott Adam Abramowitz were married Saturday evening at the Bridgehampton Tennis and Surf Club in Bridgehampton, N.Y. Rabbi Lisa Kingston, a friend of the groom, officiated.

title: Jennifer Lin and Haoming Wang
description: Jennifer Michelle Lin and Haoming Wang were married Saturday evening at La Venta Inn in Palos Verdes Estates, Calif. Roger Lundblade, a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Emily Sanchez, Charles Ogalin
description: Emily Marie Sanchez and Charles Francis Ogalin were married Saturday at the St. Patrick Roman Catholic Church in Mystic, Conn. The Rev. Kevin M. Reilly, a Roman Catholic priest, and the churchs pastor, led the ceremony.

title: Divya Kumaraiah, Sachin Shah
description: Divya Kumaraiah and Dr. Sachin Jatin Shah were married Saturday in Chicago. Marina Alexandra Birch, a Universal Life minister, officiated at the Drake Hotel, with Pandit Sree Aswath, a Hindu priest, leading a traditional Jain ceremony.

title: Kate Gordon, Matthew Liegel
description: Kate Elizabeth Gordon and Matthew Aron Liegel were married Saturday in Toledo, Ohio. The Rev. Kathleen Guthrie Lonergan, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the Toledo Club, in a ceremony that included Roman Catholic and Jewish elements.

title: Angie Wen, Jeffrey Choi
description: Dr. Angie En Wen and Jeffrey Yatsai Choi were married Saturday at the Helen Mills Event Space and Theater in New York. Patrick Tripp, a friend of the bride who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Donna Ma and Kenda Gee
description: Donna Ma, the daughter of Ping J. Ma and Peter Y. D. Ma of Seattle, was married Saturday to Kenda Dman Gee, a son of Took N. Gee of Edmonton, Alberta, and the late Sui Kiu C. Gee. Judge Dean S. Lum of the Superior Court for King County, Wash., officiated at Tacoma Union Station in Tacoma, Wash.

title: Maura Roosevelt and Joshua Fisher
description: Maura Amy Roosevelt, a daughter of Ann M. Roosevelt and James Roosevelt Jr. of Cambridge, Mass., is to be married Sunday to Joshua Louis Fisher, a son of Barbara J. Kent and Danny Fisher of Brooklyn. The Very Rev. Kevin J. OLeary, a Roman Catholic priest and the rector of the Cathedral of the Holy Cross in Boston, will officiate at Castle in the Clouds, a historic mansion and estate in Moultonborough, N.H., with Dennis P. Geller, a secular humanistic Jewish leader, taking part.

title: Dominika Rozanski, Andrs DePalma
description: Dominika Victoria Rozanski, the daughter of Anna M. Rozanski and Waldemar A. Rozanski of Manville, N.J., was married Saturday to Dr. Anthony Andrs Rodriguez DePalma, a son of Miriam R. DePalma and Anthony R. DePalma of Montclair, N.J. The Rev. Francis T. Maione, a Roman Catholic priest and the grooms godfather, performed the ceremony at St. Cassian Roman Catholic Church in Montclair.

title: Just Like in the Movies, Only Better
description: Caitlin Alexandra Johnson and Michael Gerald Dowd were married Saturday in New York. Donald J. Garamella, who became a minister with American Marriage Ministries for the event, officiated at the Wythe Hotel.

title: Elizabeth Brennan, Thomas Brennan
description: Elizabeth Walsh Brennan and Thomas Patrick Brennan were married Saturday. The Rev. Jeffrey T. Duaime officiated at Old St. Josephs Catholic Church in Philadelphia.

title: Jennifer Costanza and Amy Shopkorn
description: Jennifer Anne Costanza and Amy Melissa Shopkorn were married Thursday at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Michael M. McSweeney, the New York City clerk, officiated.

title: Sara Simmons, Philip Bartow
description: Sara Louise Simmons and Philip Key Bartow III were married Saturday at the Old Whaling Church in Edgartown, Mass. The Rev. Vincent G. Seadale, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Jennifer Cummins, Todd Rethemeier
description: Jennifer Lynn Cummins and Todd John Rethemeier were married Saturday. Tulis McCall, a minister of the Universal Brotherhood Movement, officiated at the Yale Club of New York.

title: Regina Abramyan, Stephen Oswald
description: Regina Abramyan and Stephen Gerard Oswald were married Saturday. The Rev. Bartholomew Daly performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of Our Lady of Peace in Manhattan.

title: Hayley Barna, Fredrik Maroe
description: Hayley Bay Barna and Fredrik Vik Maroe were married Saturday at Locusts-on-Hudson, a private estate and retreat in Staatsburg, N.Y. The Rev. Jude Smith, a minister ordained by the One Spirit Interfaith Seminary in New York, officiated.

title: Kelley Taylor, Jason Baum
description: Katherine Kelley McNeill Taylor, the daughter of Susanne Dolan Taylor and K. McNeill Taylor Jr. of Chatham, Mass., was married Saturday to Jason Denson Baum, a son of Dr. Laura Denson Baum and Dr. Seth J. Baum of Boca Raton, Fla. Cantor Ann Turnoff officiated at Chatham Bars Inn in Chatham, Mass., with the Rev. Dr. Nicholas J. Boas taking part.

title: Corrections: July 20, 2014
description: NEW YORK

title: Neighborhood Ravaged on Deadliest Day So Far for Both Sides in Gaza
description: GAZA CITY  The mayhem began in the early hours of Sunday morning in Shejaiya, an eastern neighborhood of Gaza City, where Israeli forces battled with Hamas militants. Terrified civilians fled, sometimes past the bodies of those struck down in earlier artillery barrages. By dusk it was clear that Sunday was the deadliest single day for the Palestinians in the latest conflict and the deadliest for the Israeli military in years.

title: As Anger Rises Over Crash, Malaysian Government Is Reluctant to Assign Blame
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  Malaysia lost 43 citizens when a missile blasted Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 from the sky over eastern Ukraine, and the countrys anger is rising toward Russia following reports that victims bodies lie uncollected or have been mishandled  especially troubling news to Malaysias many Muslims, for whom prompt, solemn burial of the dead is sacred.

title: With Poncho, Custom Weather Alerts That Say When to Pack an Umbrella
description: Every morning when I wake up, theres a peppy text message waiting in my inbox, letting me know that the summer storms are over, and that the sky will be blue and clear for the day.

title: Bodies From Malaysia Airlines Flight Are Stuck in Ukraine, Held Hostage Over Distrust
description: TOREZ, Ukraine  Three wrenching days after the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17, the bodies of most of those aboard have ended up here, in a fly-infested railway station in a rough coal-mining town in eastern Ukraine.

title: James Garner, Witty, Handsome Leading Man, Dies at 86
description: James Garner, the wry and handsome leading man who slid seamlessly between television and the movies but was best known as the amiable gambler Bret Maverick in the 1950s western Maverick and the cranky sleuth Jim Rockford in the 1970s series The Rockford Files, died on Saturday night at his home in Los Angeles. He was 86.

title: Immaculate Incarceration: A Baby in Solitary Confinement
description: At a time when most infants rock in cradles, take naps on grandmas shoulder or play bouncy-bounce on a knee, I crawled around in a 4-by-6-foot concrete box the size of a small closet. Instead of the background lullaby from a pull toy in a crib, I would have heard Chow time! yelled through the slot in the steel door and then a slam  the food port in our prison cell in solitary confinement. I was born in prison; I spent part of the first year of my life in the hole.

title: 1889: Jack The Ripper Said to Have Connection With Police
description: LONDON  One of the most interesting and, perhaps, significant points in connection with the murder of Alice Mackenzie is one to which much attention has not yet been called. At the time of the August, September and November murders last year the number of constables on patrol duty in what is known as the murder district, covered by Commercial street and Leman street stations, was strengthened by 100 extra men from other divisions. There were at that time 300 men in uniform and plain clothes on night duty in this comparatively small area. As the excitement died away this extra force was gradually diminished.

title: De Blasio and Family Land in Rome, and the Cameras Start Snapping
description: ROME  Mayor Bill de Blasio was having a paparazzi moment.

title: What Millennials Want Is Cookies Shaped Like Pizza
description: A new survey of young Americans political views has some saying millennials are incoherent or confused. One company, however, knows exactly what they want and is committed to giving it to them.

title: Kerry Says Russia Trained Separatists to Use Antiaircraft Missiles
description: WASHINGTON  In presenting the most detailed case yet alleging Russias involvement in the Ukraine crisis, Secretary of State John Kerry said on Sunday that Russia had funneled large quantities of heavy weapons to Ukrainian separatists and trained them how to operate SA-11 antiaircraft missiles, the type of system that is believed to have been used to shoot down the Malaysian airliner over eastern Ukraine.

title: A Parent Answering a Call for Pre-K Teachers Goes Back to Work (and School)
description: Long before her campers tumble out of bed for breakfast, Lisa Martino is huddled over her kitchen table, poring over her graduate school textbooks and clack-clack-clacking on her laptop as she absorbs lessons on literacy and curriculum development.

title: A Slow Weekend at Movie Theaters
description: Sex Tape failed to perform. Planes: Fire & Rescue flew a bit low. And the third major newcomer at North American movie theaters, The Purge: Anarchy, had a smaller body count than its grisly franchise predecessor. That left the weekend box office down 25 percent compared with the same three days last summer, as the No. 1 movie in the United States and Canada was a hold-over: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes (20th Century Fox), which took in an estimated $36 million, for a two-week domestic total of about $140 million.

title: Whats On TV Sunday
description: 8 P.M. (13, 49) LAST TANGO IN HALIFAX Distressing news prompts Alan (Derek Jacobi, above with Anne Reid) and Celia (Ms. Reid) to have another wedding ceremony and invite all of their family members and friends. In Endeavour, Season 2: Neverland, on Masterpiece Mystery! at 9, Detective Constable Endeavour Morse (Shaun Evans) finds the present colliding with the past  and discovers misconduct within both the police force and the upper echelons of Oxford society  when he investigates the cases of a missing boy, a dead journalist and an escaped prisoner in this season finale. And in Vicious, at 10:30, Freddie (Ian McKellen), Stuart (Mr. Jacobi) and their gang go clubbing.

title: At 25, a New King of Timeworn Ground
description: HOYLAKE, England  By the standards of final British Open chapters, this was no major thriller, but it was not the relaxed Sunday stroll around Royal Liverpool that it might have been for Rory McIlroy.

title: Kerry Expresses Frustration Over Civilian Toll in Gaza
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State John F. Kerry strongly criticized Palestinian leaders on Sunday for rejecting a cease-fire plan, but he also appeared  in comments captured by a live microphone  to express exasperation with the high cost in civilian lives as Israel pressed its ground attack on Gaza.

title: Bill Mulliken, Who Swam to Olympic Gold in 1960, Dies at 74
description: Bill Mulliken, a little-known college swimmer who outpaced national champions and the world-record holder in the 200-meter breaststroke to win gold in the 1960 Olympic Games, died on Thursday in Chicago. He was 74.

title: Learning Lear': Cue Memories
description: John Lithgow, a Tony-winning actor and writer, will be regularly blogging on ArtsBeat as he rehearses King Lear for Shakespeare in the Park.

title: 1964: Harlem Riots Flare Anew; 2 Negroes Shot
description: NEW YORK  For the third consecutive night police broke up an unruly, bottle-throwing crowd in the Negro community of Harlem tonight [July 20]. The steel-helmeted, nightstick-waving police scattered the two separate crowds without firing a pistol shot. Neither police nor members of the crowds were injured. Two Negroes were shot and wounded early today in clashes between roving gangs and scores of police. Bottles, rocks and Molotov cocktails rained down from tenement rooftops and smashed in the littered streets. In the weekend of riots, police said that one Negro was killed and 116 civilians and 18 policemen were injured. At least 45 stores were broken into and looted or damaged. The violence, and demands from civil-rights leaders that the city act to protect the Negroes, prompted the mayors office today to order a study of complaints of police brutality. Regular meetings between Harlem leaders and city officials were also arranged.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, July 21, 1964

title: Todays Students Dont Have to Suffer if They Hate Their Roommates
description: Over the last few years, many colleges and universities have adopted online roommate matching programs that help incoming students look for and select their own first-year roommates. Like dating sites, the roommate analytics systems can match people based on preferences like music volume, sociability and even tolerance for snoring.

title: Malaysian Planes Black Box Retrieved
description: The data recorder was recovered from the crash site of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 in eastern Ukraine.

title: Its a Date. See You in Therapy.
description: Very good, Martin.

title: A Thrilling Sprint Dashes a Dream and Snatches a Victory
description: NMES, France  The contrast could not have been greater. Jack Bauer was slumped against a railing, apparently in tears, teammates patting his back. Nearby, Alexander Kristoff was receiving hugs of congratulations for his second stage win of this years Tour de France.

title: SA-11 Missile Unit
description: Ukraines Interior MInistry released a video of what it said was an SA-11 missile unit, headed for the Russian border, that may have been used to shoot down Malaysia Airlines Flight 17.

title: Hoofing It From Hollywood
description: If youve seen a movie in the last 20 years, chances are you know the choreographer Marguerite Derrickss work, if not her name. Austin Powerss epic go-go dance through the streets? Ms. Derrickss idea. Abigail Breslins climactic strip routine in Little Miss Sunshine? Ms. Derricks was just off camera, encouraging Ms. Breslin to claw like a tiger. Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitts tango in Mr. and Mrs. Smith? Well, Ms. Derricks was Ms. Jolies first partner.

title: A Man, a Van, a Plan
description: JERSEY CITY  A year after its opening, the Mana Contemporary arts complex, on 35 acres here, remains largely unknown to the artgoing public. So does the man for whom its named.

title: This Constant Reinvention Called Life
description: These two things about Amy Blooms surprise-filled Lucky Us are indisputable: It opens with a terrific hook and closes with an image of exquisite resolution. But that opening sets off a string of serial adventures, and its not until the book ends that all the pieces fall into place. Ms. Bloom does not write deep-dish, straightforward yarns for readers who enjoy conventional drama. She writes sharp, sparsely beautiful scenes that excitingly defy expectation, and part of the pleasure of reading her is simply keeping up with her. You wont know where Lucky Us is headed until, suddenly, its there.

title: Out of Tune, and Seeking New Muses
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass.  When Rene Fleming tweets, she doesnt confine herself to 140 characters. In the second act of Living on Love, a fun and flimsy entertainment at the Williamstown Theater Festival here, she glides into the room warbling sweetly. Did I just hear the birds singing? she asks. Then she looses several more soaring notes. Oh no, she says, as if surprised, that was me.

title: A Reflection of the Heat, on a Pair of Pianos
description: The emblematic image of Jazz in July, the tried-and-true concert series at the 92nd Street Y, would probably be a pair of grand pianos facing each other across the stage. A New York City summer institution about to begin its 30th season, the festival has always found good use for that setup, drafting an impressive roster of jazz pianists into the service of musical dialogue. Among them are Dick Hyman, who founded Jazz in July and programmed its first two decades, and Bill Charlap, his handpicked successor.

title: What Unmentionables Cover
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Speaking, once again, of Ian Livengood, we have a debut today by a young man named Matt Fuchs, who met Mr. Livengood at a career day at their high school in Bethesda, Maryland. Mr. Livengood is an alumnus; Mr. Fuchs is still a student there.

title: U.S. Naval Ties With China Advance, Symbolically
description: The United States chief of naval operations, Adm. Jonathan W. Greenert, visited Chinas aircraft carrier last week, a symbolic step in the campaign the Pentagon is waging with Beijing for greater transparency even as the two navies become greater rivals.

title: Man of Two Faces, One Broken Heart
description: KATONAH, N.Y.  The title role of Verdis Rigoletto is one of the great Jekyll and Hyde operatic characters: a man of manipulative sneer in public and tender paternal love in private. His dual personalities were aptly illuminated at Caramoor on Saturday evening in a powerful performance by the baritone Stephen Powell.

title: Unleashing Her Voice, With Ferocity and Finesse
description: Listening to the jazz singer Gabrielle Stravelli is like imbibing a potent cocktail whose flavor changes as you drain the glass. In the first couple of sips, the predominant taste is the sparkling wine that has drifted to the top, for Ms. Stravellis bright, rippling voice exudes a natural effervescence. Before long, it darkens, and the heady liquor underneath kicks in.

title: Revisiting the Facts, After the Convictions
description: The case made  convincingly  by the documentary The Newburgh Sting is that the four upstate New York men convicted of plotting to bomb synagogues in the Bronx and destroy airplanes in 2009 were the fall guys in an elaborate, cinematic performance orchestrated by the F.B.I. The film, showing Monday on HBO, offers a competing narrative to the one presented at trial and in the news media by the government. So far, the governments story is winning: The men are all serving 25-year sentences in federal prisons.

title: A Fairy-Tale That Rocks
description: Signature Center

title: Ragtag Musicians Test Their Talent in the Catskills
description: PTC Performance Space

title: Grand National Teams Reach the Final
description: LAS VEGAS  The 64-board final of the Grand National Teams took place here Sunday between District 9 (Florida) and District 21 (Northern California and part of Northern Nevada).

title: Deliverance to Open 59E59s New Season
description: A stage adaptation of James Dickeys Deliverance will open the fall and winter season at 59E59 Theaters, that Off Broadway organization announced on Sunday. Based on the 1970 novel, which also inspired the 1972 movie of the same name starring Burt Reynolds, Jon Voight, Ned Beatty and Ronny Cox about an ill-fated canoe trip through the backwoods of Georgia, Deliverance is slated to have its world premiere on Oct. 10 as part of the Godlight Theater Companys 20th anniversary celebration. Because of the more graphic scenes of the story, approving the theatrical version a was quite a decision to make, Peter Tear, 59E59s executive producer, said by phone. He said that the playwright Sean Tyler, who adapted the story, had done a tremendous job. Other season highlights include On a Stool at the End of the Bar (Nov. 14 through Dec. 14), Robert Callelys work about a familys reaction to a loved ones long-held secret. Alex Webbs Cafe Society Swing: A True Story, a musical revue based on the 1940s jazz venue that became New York Citys first racially integrated nightclub, will follow from Dec. 16 through Jan. 4. That will also represent the return of Evan Pappas (Chorus Line, My Favorite Year,) to New York stages for the first time since 2007, when he was badly injured in a car accident while touring with On Golden Pond. Evan was one of those adored New York performers, Mr. Tear said. So people were terribly excited to hear hes coming back. Also slated for the season is the Crossroads Theater Companys production of Walter Mosleys Lift (Oct. 21 through Nov. 30); Little Opera Theater of New Yorks performance of Carlisle Floyds Slow Dusk and Markheim (Dec. 5 through 14); and Beware of Young Girls: Kate Dimbleby Sings the Dory Previn Story (Dec. 16 through Jan. 4). More information is at 59e59.org.

title: Regular Gig for Patti LuPone
description: Two years after starring in the first performances at the supper club 54 Below, Patti LuPone has signed on to appear there regularly through 2016. Ms. LuPone, a two-time Tony winner for best actress (Gypsy, 2008; Evita, 1980), will begin the first of her twice yearly, two-week engagements on Monday night with Scott Wittmans The Lady With the Torch, a collection of torch songs Ms. LuPone originally performed at Carnegie Hall in 2005. The deal makes her the first artist to sign a long-term agreement with the 54 Below, the publicist Keith Sherman said by phone by Sunday.

title: A New Project for Jolie and Pitt
description: An on-screen reunion is in the works for Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt. Donna Langley, the chairwoman of Universal Pictures, recently announced that the studio had acquired worldwide rights to Ms. Jolies next film project, By the Sea, which she will co-star in and co-produce with Mr. Pitt. Written and directed by Ms. Jolie, the film was described in a news release as an intimate, character-driven drama. Its been nine years since the couples first and last on-screen appearance, in the 2005 action comedy Mr. and Mrs. Smith, which grossed nearly $500 million worldwide. Mr. Pitt and Ms. Jolie (above) are each currently involved in World War II-focused films scheduled to reach theaters this year: Mr. Pitt will star as the leader of a tank crew in Fury, slated for release on Nov. 14 from Columbia Pictures, and Ms. Jolies sophomore directing project, Unbroken, based on the true story of the Olympian and war prisoner Louis Zamperini, is set for a Christmas Day release from Universal.

title: A Fight for the Right to Read Heidegger
description: This spring, the Students Union at the University College London banned meetings of a group called the Nietzsche Club, which was formed to discuss the ideas of philosophers who inspired, among others, far-right politicians and leaders of the past, like Benito Mussolini, an admirer of Nietzsches work. The Union Council decided that the discussion of such thinkers and ideas would foster a dangerous wave of fascism among its students, and prevented them from holding a public meeting.

title: Racy Photos Were Often Shared at N.S.A., Snowden Says
description: WASHINGTON  The former National Security Agency contractor Edward J. Snowden said in a wide-ranging interview published on Sunday that the oversight of surveillance programs was so weak that members of the United States military working at the spy agency sometimes shared sexually explicit photos they intercepted.

title: A Bloop Leads to a Blooper, Lifting the Yankees to a Sweep
description: When a batter is facing a pitcher who throws 102 miles per hour, there is not really time for directional hitting. It is the kind of heat that sends murmurs through the crowd during warm-ups. The pop of the baseball when it hits the catchers mitt echoes an extra beat, and even major league hitters take notice of the radar-gun readings. At the plate, hitters just hope for the best.

title: In Gaza, Epithets Are Fired and Euphemisms Give Shelter
description: JERUSALEM  The Gaza-based interior ministry advises its supporters in a YouTube video that whenever talking about the dead, always add an innocent citizen.  In Israel, the message is quite different: Those same victims are described as human shields sacrificed by the heartless Hamas terrorists that rule Gaza.

title: Give Us a Bishop in High Heels
description: SANDWICH, England  LAST Tuesday, on the front page of The Daily Telegraph of London, which I buy like thousands of other dementia-fearers because of the kindly crossword, I saw the face of a young woman at the General Synod at York with a bright teardrop sliding down her cheek. I thought, Oh dear! More misery. Newspapers now are only frigates of misery.

title: Universal Signs Producer of The Purge to a 10-Year Agreement
description: LOS ANGELES  At a time when movie studios have sharply reduced the number of suppliers they keep on retainer, one Hollywood producer just hit the mother lode: Universal Pictures has signed Jason Blum, the force behind microbudgeted horror series like The Purge and Insidious, to a 10-year deal.

title: Busy Doctors, Wasteful Spending
description: OF all the ways to limit health care costs, perhaps none is as popular as cutting payments to doctors. In recent years payment cuts have resulted in a sharp downturn in revenue for many hospitals and private practices. What this has meant for most physicians is that in order to maintain their income, theyve had to see more patients. When you reduce the volume of air per breath, the only way to maintain ventilation is to breathe faster.

title: Abe Reinterprets Japans Constitution
description: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is taking a new approach to Japans post-war pacifist Constitution.

title: I Had a Boyhood, Once
description: BELGRADE LAKES, Me.  AS I write this, my son Sean is outside riding a unicycle while listening to a band called the Cat Empire on headphones.

title: Want a Word With the Mayor? Youll Find Her in the Bike Convoy
description: FORT WORTH  On the same day that the worlds elite cyclists embarked on their annual race along the winding roads of England, Mayor Betsy Price  was front and center in a pack of more than 120 riders outside a popular local restaurant, poised confidently on her 18-speed carbon-fiber racing bike.

title: After Theater in Brazil, Soccers Calloused Cousin Takes the Stage
description: N.F.L. training camps open this week. With that summer ritual, the eagerly awaited heathen season is upon us. N.F.L. football is back.

title: Concern and Support for Iraqi Christians Forced by Militants to Flee Mosul
description: BAGHDAD  A day after Christians fled Mosul, the northern city controlled by Islamist extremists, under the threat of death, Muslims and Christians gathered under the same roof  a church roof  here on Sunday afternoon. By the time the piano player had finished the Iraqi national anthem, and before the prayers, Manhal Younis was crying.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: News From the Advertising Industry

title: YouTube Stars Sell Target to College Set
description: TODRICK Hall, Ann Le, Tiffany Garcia and Michael Balalis, a.k.a. Mikey Bolts, are unlikely to be household names in households of consumers in their 30s, 40s or 50s. But Target is hoping those monikers mean money as it seeks to reach members of the millennial generation who are shopping for apparel, electronics and home furnishings as they head to college.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of July 21
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.
