description: Performances by the Blind Boys of Alabama; the banjo virtuoso Bla Fleck and the singer Abigail Washburn; and a daylong celebration Johnny Cash, are among the highlights of  Symphony Spaces 2014-15 season. The season also features a concert in which the new-music ensemble eighth blackbird will play chamber works by rock composers  including Richard Reed Parry of Arcade Fire, Justin Vernon of Bon Iver and Bryce Dessner of the National.

title: Departure Ceremony for Plane Victims
description: Representatives from Australia and the Netherlands spoke at a ceremony for the victims of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 before a flight departed with their remains from the Kharkiv airport in Ukraine.

title: U.S. Proposes Faster Changes in Oil Trains
description: Federal regulators said on Wednesday that they would require railroads and oil shippers to use stronger tank cars to transport crude oil within two years.

title: Global Rallycross Comes to a Long Island Parking Lot
description: Rallycross, which puts backwoods-style rally driving on a closed track, makes it possible to have a race just about anywhere  in suburban Long Island, for example.

title: Hows California Doing?
description: The states, said Louis Brandeis, are the laboratories of democracy  although that may not work as well as it used to now that the Im not a scientist wing has taken complete control of the GOP. Still, state experiences can tell the rest of us something. Theres been a lot of talk lately about how the great Kansas tax-cut experiment is doing, namely very badly. But what about the anti-Kansas  California? Its a state with a Democratic supermajority. Its policies arent left-wing in the way Kansass are right-wing, but its enough of a liberal agenda to have the right frothing at the mouth. So how is it going?

title: Creative Types From Manolo Blahnik to Milton Glaser on Their Favorite Writing and Drawing Instruments
description: Is the pencil over? Its no secret weve turned to keyboards and touch screens to convey our thoughts, complete our work in the office and design everything from bespoke stationery to custom footwear. For most, its hard to recall the last time an octagonal wooden shaft rested between our fingers. But for a select set of highly creative individuals, writing instruments are still in high demand. Here, authors, designers and artists ranging from Manolo Blahnik to Milton Glaser share brief odes to the pencils, pens and brushes to which they are devoted, and illustrations to go along with them.

title: I Cant Hear You. The Plays Are Running.
description: For the urban eavesdropper, paradise is a place where its almost impossible not to overhear human drama unfolding: a park bench, a subway car, a quiet cafe. But in purgatory  a crowded nightclub, say  the roar of sound makes pantomime of strangers conversations.

title: Quiet Milestone in Project to Bring Croton Water Back to New York City
description: Croton.

title: Downton Abbey to Return With Season 5 on Jan. 4
description: The fifth season of Downton Abbey will begin on Jan. 4, PBSs president and chief executive, Paula Kerger, announced on Tuesday at the Television Critics Association Summer Press Tour in Beverly Hills. As in previous years, the American broadcasts follow the British screening of the series by several months, a system that allows the most ardent fans of the drama to get information about the episodes  or even copies of the episodes themselves  long before they air in the United States.

title: Filming Conflict and Culture
description: Ben C. Solomon is a roving video journalist, based in France. He covers a lot of ground; his beat includes reporting in Africa, the Middle East and occasionally Europe. We asked him about his travels and what its like to shoot video for a newspaper.

title: Phone Diplomacy in Ukraine Crisis Lifts Malaysian Leaders Standing
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  It was not an aide or a diplomat on the phone with pro-Russian rebels, trying to get them to relinquish the bodies and the black boxes from the wreckage of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 in eastern Ukraine  it was the leader of Malaysia himself.

title: Deutsche Banks Renewal Still a Work in Progress
description: Raising $12 billion last month now looks like the easy part of Deutsche Banks renewal.

title: A Dietitian Who Wont Oversell Nutrition to Her Kids
description: We sit down to eat and the bowls of food are passed around. I help my 5-year-old get his food, while my 7-year-old can fend for herself. If they refuse an item, like broccoli, I dont get into how good it is for them or how it will make them big and strong. Instead, it goes on a separate plate in case they change their mind or want to learn more about the food, which is often new or unfamiliar.

title: 1964: East Germany Seeks Germans in Poland
description: BONN  East Germany, one of the few countries of the world to suffer a loss of population following the war, is seeking to add Germans now living in Poland to its undermanned labor force. The West German Red Cross said today that East German consulates were carrying on an active campaign in Poland to persuade persons of German extraction to move to East Germany. The campaign has thus far been unsuccessful. However, reports circulated in West Germany that Poland and East Germany were about to sign an agreement for the mass resettlement of 150,000 such persons. Those involved presumably would have no choice over their fate, according to these reports.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, July 24, 1964

title: About to Close on Broadway, Of Mice and Men to Live On in British Broadcast
description: Reviewing the Broadway production of John Steinbecks Of Mice and Men, when it opened in April, Ben Brantley wrote in The New York Times that James Francos portrayal of George is a tight, internal performance begging for a cameras close-up.

title: If Judges Campaign Like Ordinary Politicians, Can We Have Impartial Courts?
description: By now its routine: Another election season, another round of expensive state judicial elections destined to undermine the core American principle of fair and impartial courts.

title: Today in Small Business: Amazons Unbreachable Moat
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Introducing Managing: Something Had to Change
description: I own a small company near Cincinnati called Finishing Technology Inc. We provide metal finishing services  anodizing, blasting, stainless passivation  typically to parts for food processing equipment (mixers and popcorn machines) and for electrical components (lugs and connectors). Many of our clients are in the automotive, aerospace and defense industries.

title: Classical Playlist: Herbert von Karajan, Brahms, Tchaikovsky and More
description: HERBERT VON KARAJAN: Choral Music 1947-1958Works by Bach, Beethoven and Brahms(Warner Classics; five discs)Warner Classics has issued a series of 13 box sets of the recordings Herbert von Karajan made for EMI between 1946 and 1984, all newly remastered. This five-CD album of choral works offers Beethovens Missa Solemnis from the mid-1950s with the Philharmonia Orchestra and a 1947 Brahms German Requiem with the Vienna Philharmonic. Of special interest for me is the 1952 account of Bachs Mass in B minor, with the Philharmonia Orchestra, the Singers of the Gesellschaft der Musikfreunde and quite a quartet of vocal soloists: Elisabeth Schwarzkopf, Marga Hffgen, Nicolai Gedda and Heinz Rehfuss. This recording, the one I grew up with, harkens to an earlier time of weighty, thick-textured Bach performances. Contrast Karajans opening Kyrie, which lasts 12:17 minutes, with Philippe Herreweghes 1996 account on period instruments, an undulant 9:29! Still, Karajan draws solemnity, depth and character from the score. A fascinating recording. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: Private Equity Giants With a Taste for Auto Body Shops
description: The Blackstone Group and the Carlyle Group are two titans of global finance, with extensive businesses in private equity, hedge funds and real estate.

title: Inside Mans Best Friend, Study Says, May Lurk a Green-Eyed Monster
description: Any dog owner would testify that dogs are just as prone to jealousy as humans.

title: Womens Project Theater Names New Producing Artistic Director
description: Updated, 3:57 p.m. | Lisa McNulty has been named the new producing artistic director of the Womens Project Theater, the Off Broadway company announced Wednesday. Ms. McNulty will replace Julie Crosby, whose abrupt departure in June led most of the theaters advisory board and several members of the theaters board of directors to quit, saying her departure, after eight years in the position, put the company at risk. The announcement comes after almost 700 people, including the playwrights Paula Vogel and Lynn Nottage, signed an online petition demanding that the boards chairwoman and chairman resign in the wake of Ms. Crosbys exit.

title: A Column of 40 Hearses Meets the Victims of the Malaysia Airlines Crash
description: EINDHOVEN AIR BASE, the Netherlands  A week ago, they had been packing their bags, preparing for conferences, family visits and vacations. Now, they were returning to the Netherlands in coffins, victims of the crash of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17, shot out of the skies above eastern Ukraine.

title: Reaction to Costa Concordia Towing
description: Officials, survivors and residents of Giglio, Italy, spoke after the Costa Concordia cruise ship was slowly towed away from the coast of the tiny island where it capsized more than two years ago.

title: Brand New Look at the Face of Mars
description: What really lies across the surface of Mars? Rovers have scurried about the red planet for years, drilling, scooping and analyzing for signs of life, past or present. But to really understand the Martian landscape, scientists need to look at the entire surface. What they have needed is a global geologic map.

title: Open Source and the Challenge of Making Money
description: Remember how the open source software movement was supposed to be like Woodstock, with everybody sharing and everything free? An entire economy where you gave a little to get a lot, in a place of love and software?

title: 5 Ways To Help Your Kid Not Stink At Math
description: In Why Do Americans Stink at Math for this weeks edition of the magazine, I wrote about the latest wave of math reforms, which are both the best chance we have of curing our national innumeracy (the mathematical equivalent of not being able to read), and a near guarantee at driving children and their parents understandably insane. As I write in the story, the problem is not the new approach itself. The problem is our widespread failure to help teachers figure out how to teach in the new way.

title: Leader of Troubled Lab Steps Down, C.D.C. Says
description: The leader of the federal bioterrorism lab in which careless procedures may have exposed dozens of workers to live anthrax has resigned, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention announced Wednesday.

title: Pennsylvanias Auditor General Faults Oversight of Natural Gas Industry
description: PHILADELPHIA  Environmental officials in Pennsylvania have failed to adequately regulate the states booming natural gas industry, a state report said, reflecting what critics say is weak oversight of the oil and gas industry at a time when drilling is spreading across the United States.

title: British Souvenirs Made (One at a Time) in Britain
description: Not interested in a double-decker bus paperweight or a William and Kate mug? Consider the the Real British Souvenir Shop show through August at the New Craftsmen, a recently opened fine craft shop in the Mayfair section of London.

title: Google Acquires DrawElements
description: Google struck a small deal on Wednesday, agreeing to acquire a 3-D graphics company called drawElements.

title: Dole, Slumped but Sharp, Returns to Senate to Push Disabilities Treaty
description: WASHINGTON  Former Senator Bob Dole returned on Wednesday to the institution he once led, his posture more slumped, his legs less sturdy, but his wits still sharp.

title: Why the Sucker List of Jordan Belfort, the Wolf of Wall Street, Wont Be Released to Inside Edition

title: Senators Thesis Turns Out to Be Remix of Others Works, Uncited
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats were thrilled when John Walsh of Montana was appointed to the United States Senate in February. A decorated veteran of the Iraq war and former adjutant general of his states National Guard, Mr. Walsh offered the Democratic Party something it frequently lacks: a seasoned military man.

title: Nibali Still Leads the Pack as Fast Food Fails to Help the Vuelta Winner
description: PLA DADET SKI STATION, France  Vincenzo Nibali, the leader of the Tour de France, may seem invincible at the moment, but Chris Horner knows how to beat him. Last year, Horner crushed Nibali in the mountains to become the first American to win the Vuelta a Espaa.

title: Deutsche Bank Shares Waver on Reports of Regulators Letter
description: Updated, 5:34 p.m. | FRANKFURT  Deutsche Bank shares slipped slightly Wednesday, and its efforts to rebuild its reputation suffered another blow, after reports that a regulator in the United States had found serious problems with the banks financial reporting procedures and oversight.

title: Met Opera Prepares to Lock Out Workers
description: The labor strife at the Metropolitan Opera took on a new urgency Wednesday when its general manager, Peter Gelb, sent the companys orchestra, chorus, stagehands and other workers letters warning them to prepare for a lockout if no contract deal is reached by next week.

title: Nelson Peltzs Efforts to Shake Up Pepsi Get Backing of Calstrs
description: Updated, 4:11 p.m. | The activist investor Nelson Peltz has won the support of one of the largest pension funds in the United States in his campaign against PepsiCo.

title: Pressure Grows on E.U. Regulator to Rethink Google Settlement
description: BRUSSELS  During the past five years, Google has taken a gingerly approach to fighting its antitrust battles in the European Union, nurturing a working relationship with Joaqun Almunia, the blocs competition commissioner, and patiently presenting him with three sets of proposals to settle antitrust complaints that it favored its own business over that of rivals in search results.

title: Stealing a Page From the Boomers Playbook
description: When we last checked in with Alice Fisher, Hurricane Sandy had forced her ailing 90-year-old parents out of their ruined co-op apartment in Long Beach, N.Y., where they had expected  with the enthusiastic approval of their two daughters  to live out their days.

description: Senator John Walsh, Democrat of Montana, was appointed by Gov. Steve Bullock in February to fill the seat vacated by Max Baucus, a six-term senator who stepped down to become the United States ambassador to China.

title: Stephen Colbert Will Keep CBSs Late Show in New York
description: New Yorks status as the center of late-night television was reinforced on Wednesday after CBS announced that its Late Show," which under David Letterman has been based in New York since 1993, will remain in the city when Stephen Colbert steps in as host next year.

description: Workman Publishing, one of the countrys largest independent publishers of nonfiction trade books, has appointed a new chief executive, its first since the death of its founder, Peter Workman, last spring.

description: DETROIT  The trial of a suburban homeowner accused of the shotgun shooting of a young black woman last fall opened on Wednesday with jarring images projected on a large screen before jurors. Renisha McBride, 19, grinning for the camera. And then, Ms. McBride, bloodied and lifeless on a porch.

description: Regulators on Wednesday imposed new restrictions on a vast market that played a significant role in the 2008 financial crisis.

title: The Location May Stay the Same, but Everything Else Will Change
description: Its not quite site-specific theater, but the Worlds Fair Play Festival, a collection of short works by well-regarded playwrights, benefits beautifully from its location: the Queens Theater on the grounds of the 1964 and 1939 Worlds Fairs. The writers have delivered nuggets that catch the wistful ambience of the place deliciously.

title: ngel Corella Is Named Artistic Director of Pennsylvania Ballet
description: The former American Ballet Theater principal ngel Corella will become the artistic director of the Pennsylvania Ballet in September, the company announced on Tuesday. Mr. Corella, who left Ballet Theater in 2012 to devote himself to the company he had founded in 2008 in his native Spain, closed that troupe, the Barcelona Ballet, last year. (The company toured in New York in 2010 and 2012, receiving mixed reviews.)

title: Remembering a Man Whose Death Made Him a Symbol of a Divide
description: As the sun set over Brooklyn on Wednesday, hundreds of people gathered to mourn a man who died after begging for air.

title: UBS Being Investigated in France Over Tax Evasion
description: PARIS  UBS, the largest Swiss bank, was placed under formal investigation by the French authorities on Wednesday and ordered to post bail of more than $1 billion in the kind of tax-evasion case that ensnared it in the United States several years ago.

title: Travels in a Maze in Mexico
description: On the back cover of Francisco Goldmans new book about Mexico City, two blurbs describe it as funny. Now Mexicans can be very funny, but there is nothing funny about The Interior Circuit: A Mexico City Chronicle. How could there be? Dwelling as it does on booze, drugs, corruption, violence and murder, it offers a decidedly bleak picture of one of the worlds largest metropolises.

title: On Capri, a Chic New Shop Takes a Stand Against Sameness
description: This whole business was against mass prestige, explains Helen White in the intimate space of Cabana, her newly opened shop on Capri. In a world in which luxury is becoming ubiquitous and traveling to Asia lands you in the same shops youd find on Madison Avenue, she is indeed taking a position. Cabana is unique: almost everything in its edited collection of objects and clothes for resort life is not available anywhere else. Many items, from cutlery (bamboo-handled knives emblazoned with the stores name) to beach bags, are sourced and designed by White and custom-made for the store.

title: New Twists for Wooden Roller Coasters
description: Wait, a wooden coaster that goes upside down? For many of us who have spent a lot of our childhoods (and adulthoods) at theme parks, the idea of a wooden coaster with a loop or a spiral seems counterintuitive. After all, woodies, as theyre called, are known for their sprawling beauty, not the heart-pounding features that have made modern steel coasters so exciting.

title: Gileads Hepatitis C Drug, Sovaldi, Is on Pace to Become a Blockbuster
description: Sales of the new hepatitis C drug Sovaldi reached $3.5 billion in the second quarter, a huge figure that puts it on track to become one of the worlds best-selling medicines but could intensify concerns about societys ability to pay for it.

title: The Thrill of a Lifetime, Tinged by Teary Respect
description: At the end of the concluding work in the inspiring concert by the National Youth Orchestra of the United States of America at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night, the conductor David Robertson spoke to the audience about the irrepressible enthusiasm and energy of the young players, ages 16 to 19, in this select ensemble. Even after a concert lasting two and a half hours, a program that opened with a fresh, urgent account of Bernsteins Symphonic Dances from West Side Story and ended with a weighty, richly characterized performance of Mussorgskys Pictures at an Exhibition, these eager players looked ready for more.

title: Facebooks Profit Propelled by Mobile
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Once again demonstrating its mastery of the mobile computing wave, Facebook dazzled Wall Street on Wednesday by posting significant growth in revenue and profits for the second quarter, driven largely by ads shown in the news feeds of a billion Facebook users checking the service on their mobile phones.

The opening week of Swan Lake at the Lincoln Center Festival had been so dispiritingly overcast, but now here was the sun.

title: Enter Will, With Tongue Still in Cheek
description: LONDON  Many people, it must be said, prefer the idea of Shakespeares plays to the reality of them. Whether they admit it or not, such souls feel that Shakespeare is great for seasoning but indigestible as a main course. Theyre often the ones you hear promiscuously peppering their conversation with the canons best-known lines or speaking of failed politicians as truly Shakespearean.

title: Speaking Her Language
description: The actress, singer and Nicolas Ghesquire muse Charlotte Gainsbourg, celebrated for her undone Parisian style, has joined forces with the Current/Elliott creative director Serge Azria on a capsule collection thats out this week. The garments reflect the prevailing perception about the strenuously edited French wardrobe, with its combination of unfussy staples and just-loud-enough statement pieces. There are sharp blazers and raw denim jeans, which, worn together, is very much Ms. Gainsbourgs look, and layering knits and cotton shirting to mix in. A red leather jacket is one of the standouts, and theres a pair of mini (read: supershort) shorts that are covetable but may require Gainsbourg genes to pull off. At currentelliott.com.

title: In Chelsea, a Pedestrian-Friendly Night of Art
description: On one evening each summer since 2010, the Chelsea Art Walk has transformed the gallery-rich blocks of New York between West 16th and 30th Streets into a welcoming arena for visitors, connoisseurs and people getting off work to discover contemporary art.It returns this Thursday, July 24, for its fifth iteration, with nearly 100 participating galleries, nine open studios, artists talks and, naturally, cocktail ceremonials from 5 to 8 p.m. The event uses the High Line as its central vein, giving visitors the ability to experience a Manhattan sunset from above the busy streets between gallery pop-ins.

title: At a Spanish Border, a Coordinated Scramble
description: MELILLA, Spain  More than 1,000 African migrants rushed toward the high fences topped with razor wire. They were met by the Moroccan police, who, with the support of the Spanish military police and a Spanish helicopter, thwarted their plan to scale the fences and enter Europe through this tiny Spanish enclave that clings to northern Morocco.

title: The Number That Many French Businesses Fear
description: GUILLES, France  Philippe Plantier, a seasoned French mountaineer, was rappelling down a cliff more than a decade ago when the inspiration struck: He could turn his passion for climbing into a business.

title: Acetaminophen No Better Than Placebo for Back Pain
description: About two-thirds of adults have lower back pain at some point in their lives, and most are told to take acetaminophen, sold under brand names like Tylenol and Panadol. Medical guidelines around the world recommend acetaminophen as a first-line treatment.

title: Style in Nashvilles 12South Neighborhood
description: In recent years, the 12South neighborhood of Nashville has undergone drastic changes. The city improved the sidewalks and increased street lighting. More residents and popular businesses, like Jenis Splendid Ice Creams and the denim purveyors Imogene & Willie, have moved in. On a balmy day typical of Nashville summers, Logan Yandell was relaxing at a local coffee shop, the Frothy Monkey. Mr. Yandell will be moving to Boston soon to further his music studies, and sees his signature Goorin Brothers hat, ostrich-skin boots and tattoos as a way to stay connected to home. This interview has been edited and condensed.

This year, forced out of its bucolic birthplace by a real estate development, the party relocated to Industry City, a warehouse complex in Sunset Park.
